page.title: 01Ballingry - Location
page.content:
This D-Block is situated in west{Fife and contains part of{ Tayside region. The north-west part of the{Ballingry area is made up of woodland and hills, such as{Benarty Woods, Vane Hill}and {Navitie Hill. Dunmore}is the highest peak at 255m. Nestling beneath the hills is the parish of{Ballingry}including{Lochore, {Crosshill}and{Glencraig,}which make up the residential part of this area. The south-west part, in contrast, is low lying around the{Westfield}gas and open-cast complexes.
Distances from Ballingry- Lochgelly- 4.8km Cowdenbeath- 11.3km Kirkcaldy- 16.4km Glenrothes- 12.8km Dunfermline-16.8km Perth- 14.1km Edinburgh- 40.4km Glasgow- 88.7km
Audrey Henderson (12)
